ETYMOLOGY: From Old English sæmann, from sæ 'sea' + mann 'man'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person, especially a man, who works on a ship or boat; a sailor or mariner.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在船上工作的人，尤指水手或海员。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old seaman shared tales of his voyages across the stormy seas.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位老水手分享了他航行于暴风雨海域的故事。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An enlisted person of the lowest rank in a navy.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 海军中最低级别的士官。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He joined the navy and began his career as a seaman.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他加入了海军，并以水兵的身份开始了军旅生涯。
